{{Infobox Radio station |image =<!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:Abclocalradio.png]] -->| |name = 630 ABC North Queensland| |callsign = 4QN| |coordinates = {{Coord|19|15|23.29|S|146|49|17.41|E|type:landmark_scale:2000_region:AU}} |airdate = 26 November 1936 | |frequency = 630 [[kilohertz|kHz]] [[amplitude modulation|AM]] | |area = [[North Queensland]]| |owner = [[Australian Broadcasting Corporation]] | |format = [[Talk radio|Talk]] | |website = [http://www.abc.net.au/northqld/ http://www.abc.net.au/northqld/] | }}
'''630 ABC North Queensland''' is an [[ABC Local Radio]] station based in [[Townsville]] broadcasting to [[North Queensland]]. This includes the towns of [[Bowen, Queensland|Bowen]], [[Charters Towers, Queensland|Charters Towers]], [[Ingham, Queensland|Ingham]] and [[Ayr, Queensland|Ayr]].
The station began broadcasting as '''4QN''' in 1936. It was originally a relay station covering the whole of North Queensland with limited local news bulletins. Local program content increased in the 1960s and the station was also the home of regional [[ABC Television (Australia)|ABC Television]] in Townsville, [[Cairns]] and [[Mount Isa]].
By the 1980s local program content was broadcast for most of the day, as well as a separate regional breakfast program. 4QN was also the headquarters of the regional network.
[[John Nutting]] launched the ''Saturday Night Country'' show in 1994 from 4QN which is now broadcast nationally. The Townsville studios were also home to the first [[Indigenous Australians|Aboriginal and Islander]] broadcasting in [[Australia]].
==Local Programs== ===Weekdays===
*Breakfast with Michael Clarke â 5:00 AM to 7:45 AM *Rural News with Miriam Hall - 6:15 AM to 6:30 AM *Mornings with Paula Tapiolas â 8:30 AM to 11:00 AM *Drive with Pat Hession - 4.00 PM to 6.00 PM
===Saturday===
*Saturday Breakfast with Zane Bojack â 6:00 AM to 8:00 AM *Northern Grandstand with Zane Bojack â 8:30 AM to 10:00 AM
When local programs are not broadcast the station is a relay of [[ABC Capricornia]] and [[612 ABC Brisbane]].
